here we are

I just also want to let you know that I

month off and I flew to different states

I've had a month to grieve and to really

anyways I'm really sorry that I am

to make it as positive as possible
because that's what my dad would want
cuz that's kind of his energy and who he
was as a person and for those of you
wondering a lot of people were asking me
what happened I thought this would be a
really good time to just sit down and
talk to you and let you know my dad was
diagnosed with leukemia about six years
ago in 2013 and there's different types
of leukemia and he had the aggressive
type and we were really worried as a
family that we wouldn't even get a year
with him because he tried chemotherapy
and it did not do anything it did not
work at this time is the same time that
a new medication
that was approved by the FDA that for
40% of the people taking it in my dad's
position it was effective and for my dad
it was it gave us six more years with
him that we would have not had and I
kind of wrote down a list of all of the
things that we did over the last six
years that wouldn't have happened
without this new medication and I just
wanted to share some of those things
with you all because those are the
things that I really appreciate and I'm
really grateful for because of the new
medication my dad got to walk my sister
down the aisle at her wedding we got to
go on numerous fun family vacations we
went to Hawaii when year we even did
Christmas in Hawaii
not only vacations but we got to spend
so much time together because for half
the year my mom and dad moved in with me
here in California and so we got to live
under one roof and we played tons of
Romek you but I don't know if you guys
know that game but that was one of my
dad's favorite board games or tabletop
games my dad got to celebrate his 40th
wedding anniversary with my mom they
were married for 43 years but they
celebrated their 40th here actually in
this house in the backyard my sister and
I went all out and we recreated their
original wedding we even recreated their
ugly wedding cake and it was a big joke
because it was not the cake they ordered
so we recreated the disaster cake and we
had music delicious food all of his
close friends and family and my dad told
us numerous times that that day the 40th
wedding anniversary was one of the best
days of his life he had so much fun he
even got to jam and play music with his
friends

their mission is to cure leukemia
lymphoma and Hodgkin's disease and
